javax.ws.rs.ext
Interface RequestFilter

public interface RequestFilter

Interface implemented by filters invoked at the Pre extension point. Filters implementing this interface MUST be annotated with Provider.

As part of the client API, these filters are executed before the HTTP invocation. As part of the server API, these filters are executed before the resource method is called but after it has been matched. If processing is required before resource matching, a PreMatchRequestFilter should be used instead.

Since:
2.0
Author:
Santiago Pericas-Geertsen, Bill Burke
See Also:
PreMatchRequestFilter

Method Summary
 FilterContext.FilterAction preFilter(FilterContext context)
          Filter method called at the Pre extension point.
 

Method Detail

preFilter

FilterContext.FilterAction preFilter(FilterContext context)
                                     throws IOException
Filter method called at the Pre extension point. I.e., before the HTTP invocation in the client and before the resource method invocation (but after resource matching) in the server. This method can return FilterContext.FilterAction.NEXT to continue the execution of the filter chain, or FilterContext.FilterAction.STOP to abort the execution of the filter chain (e.g., a caching filter may want to stop execution upon a cache hit).

Parameters:
context - invocation context
Returns:
filter action to continue or stop filter chain
Throws:
IOException
